page.title: 12TEENAGERS' VIEWS
page.content:
{Unemployed teenager: } Ian is a Chaddesden teenager. He left school with 5 O levels and followed a Youth Training Scheme (Y.T.S.) as a mechanic. He doesn't recommend this scheme as the key to a job. He gets Â£18.45 a week on the dole. He spends about three hours a week looking for a job through the{Job Centre}adverts and the local newspaper. He passes the time at unemployment clubs and playing football.
{Employed teenager:} Paul left school at 17 with 7 C.S.E. exams passes. He got a job as a trainee accountant. He was not very enthusiastic about the Y.T.S. policy. He like to play football and badminton and still goes to the youth club. He has enough money to buy a drink at night and buy clothes.
